intro: Lopezia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered Lopezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family, Asteraceae, and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Lopezia macrantha is often found in open habitats such as plains and hillsides.
